website_summaries.verdict: A simple, attractive doorbell that's easy to set up. Not fancy, but gets the job done.
pros: easy to hear throughout the house
Easy to install, though depending on your setup, might require some drilling
cons: Only three chimes to choose from, and a few users report some issues with the receiver's range

website_summaries.verdict: A very reliable, versatile device with security accessories available. Worth considering if its contemporary design appeals to you.
pros: Features an appealing, modern design and is compatible with security accessories like motion detectors and door contacts
Extremely dependable and easy to set up
Can be used as a portable device or wall-mounted
cons: Only six chimes are available, but you can listen to them on Amazon before you buy
Not as straight-forward as other systems to expand
450-foot operating range is on the shorter end

website_summaries.verdict: This doorbell stands out for its optional visual alerts and its sturdy construction.
pros: Features 6 chimes, and can work with up to 6 different buttons or triggers
Volume is adjustable and can get loud
Receiver has an optional light alert
AC plug-in jack in case you want to wire it in
cons: This model goes through batteries pretty quickly
Some buyers found the range to be less than the claimed 450 feet

customer_reviews.title: These units are amazing! I have two of them in our warehouse ...
customer_reviews.text: These units are amazing! I have two of them in our warehouse with three different button tones. We know which door was rung due to the different tones. Very good for home or business. I've only replaced one button in a few years and maybe batteries once a year. I drilled the buttons and base unit into concrete block with a hammer drill. Just a small plastic anchor and it's done. The push buttons are on a flat wall with no roof so I put some electrical tape around them to keep out moisture (as seen in the photos). Excellent! Excellent! I already got another set for my mom's house and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell RCWL330A1000
customer_reviews.text: Be careful! In the information, it says that this doorbell needs 1 CR2 battery. It also says that no batteries are supplied. This doorbell does NOT need a CR2 battery. I needs 4 C batteries. If you buy this doorbell, buy C batteries for it. I had to return the CR2 battery that I ordered with the doorbell. Otherwise, I've been using a very similar doorbell for years now without any problems. This is a fancier model that I bought for the upstairs apartment. The same model that I have is no longer available. It's very easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: pl

customer_reviews.title: Loud chimes
customer_reviews.text: We love this unit. The volume is plenty loud even for the hard-of-hearing. Works great through many walls. We bought an extra button for the back door. Only, it does not tell me which button was pushed. So I just go to the front door first. The light on the unit is very useful if there are other devices connected to it. We only used the doorbell feature. Several chimes to choose from. The chime sounds sound genuine and not like a recording. Mounting hardware is included (screws, anchors). Takes D batteries for a very long life. Also has a AC plug-in jack for a power cord (sold separately) We are very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Probably a good product, but deceptive description. Advertised 3 push buttons, only comes with one. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JoeMC

customer_reviews.title: Great! Works Just Like it Should
customer_reviews.text: Very good and reliable! The only thing I don't like is that we use it partially as a door chime on the front door. You can't set the tone for that door trigger. It's a little harsh, but we have it in a place where that's not a problem. We also have a button that clients ring for service on the reception desk. You can set the tone for that one, and it works just fine. One star off because of the non-changeable door chime, but otherwise, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Arpboy

customer_reviews.title: No problem hear this equipment
customer_reviews.text: Item appears to work very well (I have metal framed door and metal bars on windows. No matter position I set it, the unit picks up the button pushes. Also, volume levels are more than adequate and the flashing light on the main unit is an added touch just in case the doorbell is not heard but visually one knows the button was pushed. So far, so good. Only time will tell how well it holds up. lastly, love the AC adapter option for main unit
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Man

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, flexible in use.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of replacement options when the old doorbell failed and even bought one but returned it because it was cheesy. This Honeywell cost a bit more but is obviously better built and superior to anything else I considered. The company is well regarded for a reason. Other than a little cosmetic painting to cover the old chime's footprint, the installation took only minutes. It offers multiple rings and the volume is adjustable. The design is unobtrusive. Given that doorbells aren't in constant use (as opposed to thermometers and other such devices) the battery should last for years and even when it goes, the replacement will be quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jayress

customer_reviews.title: Both work great together. I bought that and a couple of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. FYI you can buy a honeywell little gadget that wires directly to your doorbell and transmits a signal to this thing, so you don't have to tape up one of their plasticky little doorbells in addition to your wired doorbell. Both work great together. I bought that and a couple of these, one for attic and one for downstairs, so we could hear doorbell better.
customer_reviews.author: Parent & Homeowner

customer_reviews.title: The description on this product says it comes with a ...
customer_reviews.text: The description on this product says it comes with a door chime and 3 push buttons, it arrived with a door chime and one push button ???? Product was not as described
customer_reviews.author: PAM BENTLEY

customer_reviews.title: These are great. This is replacing my first one that was ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. This is replacing my first one that was brilliant as a solution to place in the front window of my porch so that I can see people approaching the house with the flashing lights and notifying intruders that there is an alarm system. Bright flashing lights are very alarming to people not expect ting them who enter. Motion detector attachment needed to use this way, great investment
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Revista

customer_reviews.title: Used as call alarm for handicapped person
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version that played music and not the standard doorbell rings. This newer version plays standard doorbell rings that sound a lot like our doorbell which makes it confusing to know if someone is at the door or son needs help. There are six doorbell tones that allow some options but still preferred the music tones. I would recommend it for anyone that needs a portable door bell so someone who handicapped to be able to call for assistance when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Electrician
customer_reviews.text: I have a two family house.When one bell works the other don't. Called the electrician to fix one of the inopertable bells. A week later the other bell wasn't working. So I decided that I will no longer will pay an over priced electrician. I bought two of these wireless door bells, one for my apartment the other for my tenants upstairs. The cost of both bells was half the cost of the electrian. This bell chimes loud and the volume is adjustable. I made a great choice with getting this product. Sometimes I like to play my music very loudly and the flashing light feature alerts me if someone is ringing the door bell. Simply love this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Laborde

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Covers front door
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Covers front door, back door, garage door (people door), I can even tell which door they are at.
customer_reviews.author: Howard B

customer_reviews.title: Love the feature of the blinking light and the chimes ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for Christmas for my father-in-law. He is in his 90's and his wife is deaf. Love the feature of the blinking light and the chimes are very loud. He takes care of her due to alzheimers and he was missing when someone would come to his door.
customer_reviews.author: Whitedove

customer_reviews.title: Perfect if you are looking for no wire door bell
customer_reviews.text: Perfect if you are looking for no wire door bell. We had a cheap one from when we moved in that was battery operated and it went out a while ago. I recently replaced it with this one; wish I had sooner! Love all the different choices on it; just wish you were able to connect a wireless camera bell to it; that’s the only thing that could make this unit any better. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Heather F.

customer_reviews.title: Do not understand how to use it because there's not another part that came with it
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand how to use this it didn't come with anything but this chime is there something I'm supposed to go with this so I can hear the doorbell ring I have had it sitting in the house for two years never used it because I didn't understand it
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I've had this doorbell for 6 months or a year now (Amazon doesn't make it easy to see when I ordered it). It was easy to install and it works really well. Don't compare this to whatever crummy battery operated doorbell you've had in the past - this is great. I set it for a pleasant musical chime - really like it. My only complaint is that the push button is ugly white plastic - wish there were upgrades available
customer_reviews.author: Kat B

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do -- and does it well
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these upstairs for years, but got tired of not hearing the doorbell when in the basement, so I bought a second unit. Works like a charm with a simple configuration. Good product. Long-lasting batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Halloween is coming , how's your ding dong ?
customer_reviews.text: Ding dong: as easy as putting in 4 c batteries. Sound is great. It is loud enough for my hearing imparied wife with the added benift of the blue flashing lights ! The hardest part was cutting the evil plastic enclosing this reasonably priced product. It would make a great gift for a mother in law . If you needs some brownie points .
customer_reviews.author: Francis Joseph

customer_reviews.title: This Honeywell system works great in our house
customer_reviews.text: I had bought two different wireless bells at national hardware chains, but returned both. This Honeywell system works great in our house. We bought an extra switch for the backdoor and the signal reaches the receiver from both locations. My only hesitation is that the instruction manual states that the switches only work down to 14 degrees. I'm assuming that is battery related. We're getting some temps dipping into the negative digits tonight so I'll test to see if the system stops working. It would be a shame, as large parts of the United States regularly see temperatures below 14 degrees throughout the winter.
customer_reviews.author: PackAttack

customer_reviews.title: Questionable battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a quick fix for a doorbell. No wiring needed and I was not interested in a camera/doorbell that requires the use of my cell phone. This initially worked great, but after four months I noticed the doorbell not ringing so I checked and the four C-batteries (new Everyready) in the indoor chime-receiver were dead. There is also a button battery on the outside doorbell switch. So, the future of this product in my home may be limited.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brady

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wireless door bell for the rear of the house. I'm very surprised at how loud the chime is. Unit does have a volume control. And the wireless distance is really good, since I have double brick walls and unit is about 50' from wireless bell. In case someone is hard of hearing, the flashing light is extremely bright too. I like it so much, I bought an extra wireless door bell for the gate and also bought the Converter/Extender to have the gate chime if someone opens the gate, without ringing the bell first. You can assign different sounding chimes and the display lights up to tell you unit is chiming in case you forget.
customer_reviews.author: RB Tucson, AZ

customer_reviews.title: love it!....
customer_reviews.text: I had been having trouble with my in home wiring for the door bell. The transformer would last about 30 days & burn out. Replaced the chime assy, previously. With a good result for a while, then transformer dead again. I was tired of screwing with the issues and this one. The in home wired system was retired in place. Disconnected the transformer and put a light in it's place for the garage. Easy set-up, too get the system up an running...very simple...too. Battery life maybe a question? Uses "C" batteries. Two months old, the system seems to be operating normally with good volume & tone... Should have bought this earlier, rather than the transformers. Love the strobe light function.
customer_reviews.author: Roz'E

customer_reviews.title: Wireless doorbell with some serious range
customer_reviews.text: I searched and searched for a doorbell which could connect to my home office wirelessly - a separate building in the back of my house, about 100 ft from my front door with 2 brick walls and several internal walls separating the two. This puppy pulled it off with flying colors - hasn't missed a ring yet. Additionally, the pairing is simple as can be, which was important since I bought two to have an extra receiver in the main house. Most wireless doorbells I looked at didn't have that range, including a couple I tried out. This is a great doorbell for applications needing long range and a quick, easy install.
customer_reviews.author: Zander707

customer_reviews.title: Never knew what I was missing.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large hole in my hearing spectrum and could not hear the door chime when upstairs. This device lets me put the chime anywhere I choose (no wires!). Now my dear wife is no longer tasked with informing me someone is at the door. It has a good selection of tones, and the back door (which previously was mute) has a distinct sound. Nirvana! Installation? None, really, unless you want to get fancy. The chime can be hung on a wall, or just set on a flat surface. The push buttons can be mounted with double sided tape, if you choose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this doorbell.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about three and a half years ago and it has been installed about three years of that time, with front, back and two other remotes. I am extremely pleased with it. I did buy several remotes because my elderly mother lives with me and I wanted her to be able to call me so that I could hear if she needed me. Unfortunately, we have had to use it that way for the past few months and it has been a godsend. I originally thought we could carry it in the yard and it will work up to a distance, but probably not as far as reported, but that has not been an issue here for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Well designed, well made, and economical
customer_reviews.text: We installed these on each of three floors actuated by a single front door pushbutton. It is an excellent, easy to install system with chime alternates and volume control. I have a hearing loss but this chime comes through loud and clear. The pushbutton provides instant feedback with a light that assures callers that the chime has been sounded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: We are getting old and sometimes can't hear the doorbell, nor distinguish the front from the side. We wanted something that flashes, has a lot of volume, and different chimes for the different doors. I also didn't want to reuse or replace the old wires which are buried in the walls, and brittle. This unit has everything we wanted. Delivery was prompt. The instructions were a little week, but I managed to get it working. They say do not mount it on metal, but all the framing around my doors is aluminum, and the door is steel, so I mounted it on the aluminum framing and it works.
customer_reviews.author: clevelandbrown

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a wireless door chime from Home Depot. At first it worked then the cheap doorbell would not transmit to the base unit. I was skeptical of the Honeywell because the base unit was not plug-in. It requires 4 C cell batteries. The good news is you only have to replace the batteries every two years. It's portable with a 450 foot range. You can expand it with optional door and window sensors for an alarm system. No monthly fees! The base unit has 6 different chimes then it flashes brightly for the hearing impaired. For less than $50 bucks this is a no brainier. It works as advertised and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: Really plug and play -- love this
customer_reviews.text: Agree with other reviewers that this is SO easy to install and use, and the variety of chimes is invaluable. I used the last chime, which is the softest, and it fools my barkaholic sheltie into not noticing that Oh a Doorbell Has Been Rung, I Must Go Nuts. Very easy to attach the push button, stick the chime on a hallway bookshelf and call it done. Got this on Amazon Warehouse Deals. Some screws were missing, but I had in my shop miscellany workable fasteners, so no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Belliveau

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this product. all i can say is 450 feet what a joke more like 50 feet. We live in a rear Unit, with the front door located approximately 100 to 150 feet from the button and the receiver does not receive the signal (this is with brand new batteries). emailed customer support and no response at all.
customer_reviews.author: genkifd

customer_reviews.title: Would have been nice if they told you in the description you will ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have been nice if they told you in the description you will need 4 C batteries !! Haven't installed it because I don't have C batteries in the house. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: deborah linskey

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Our elderly aunt had one of the old "wired" doorbells that quit working. All I can say is...SHE LOVES IT!!! Decent price; bought a second pushbutton for her back door...they paired without any effort or problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: JustUs

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the best and loudest battery door bell
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best and loudest battery door bell. The previous one (not Honeywell) was not loud enough. I can hear this one everywhere in the house and yard. In the 2 years I have had it I have replaced the button batteries once and have not replaced the wall unit batteries at all. I like the idea that no 110 volt wall plug is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great product if you need the extra range from door to chime
customer_reviews.text: GREAT range -- can be placed much further from the wireless doorbell button than any other unit I've owned. Flawless 50' away and through a door and around a corner. Same goes for the Honeywell motion sensor I purchased along with this -- which rings with a different chime than the buzzer. Wouldn't mind were it less pricey... but for the extra distance and the multi-sensor compatibility I'm one happy camper. I'll probably add a second buzzer to cover another entryway... in fact, I'll add that NOW! Thanks, Honeywell!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell RCWL330A1000/N P4-Premium Portable.  LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Mom's getting old.. so i gave her a button to push if she wants or needs me. I also got a 1 year on 9volt battery wireless motion sensor which works with this too. I love this thing. different sounds for the button.. or the motion detector.. has a Bright strobe iight for deaf people or no sound solution. in noisy area's. and you can switch between combos. I think it can use 4 sensors/triggers. Best thing is NO WIRES.. everything is wireless and battery. So far the batterys last without replacement.
customer_reviews.author: stumpedI

customer_reviews.title: Great for hearing impaired
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Good volume and the chimes are portable. I have significant hearing loss and couldn't hear my old doorbell from my upstairs office. This fixed that in two ways. Firs it is lounder and second I could place the chime in the stairwell between floors so it could be heard throughout the house. The product has options that I haven't bothered to investigate, I'm so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dale West

customer_reviews.title: Not nearly as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: First, we can't change the chimes even though we're supposed to be able to. Second, they don't make it clear that you need to also purchase a motion detector to make this work. Once we got the motion detector we were able to start using it (today). It works, in so much as it rings when someone walks past the motion detector, but it's not the sound we would have liked. It's just the only sound that works. Unfortunately, we can't return it because we only just got it installed, even though we have had it for several months. If we could return it, we would. i would really like to give it only 2-1/2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Suz-Z-Q

customer_reviews.title: Thank you, Honeywell!
customer_reviews.text: Showed it to a neighbor with a hearing disability as I do. We both highly recommend it. I do not put it on the wall and take it to whatever room I spend time in. The flashing lights are amazing! If you cannot hear it for whatever reason you surely can see it all lit up. Oh, takes about five minutes to get it working. Be prepared to get your "C" batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 1 1/2 year. Very expensive for something very lousy. Also you need to replace batteries all the time. Buh another brand.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a deaf person who needed a flashing light ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a deaf person who needed a flashing light. The flasher needs to be within one's range of vision in the daytime, and after the sun goes down, will bounce flash off walls noticeably. Although there are icons for up to six inputs, actually only two are possible: doorbells and motion detector (separate purchase.) There is no product for telephone input, confirmed by calling the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: ... one purchased about 18 months ago is still working fine without even having yet replaced the original batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Honeywell door chime with strobe and so far the first one purchased about 18 months ago is still working fine without even having yet replaced the original batteries. The second one I mounted in my basement. I have four transmitters - one front door, one back door and two of them accessible for my handicapped wife who can use them as a sort of alarm system to summon me in our rather large home. Each transmitter has its own distinctive chime and would obviously prompt the appropriate response.
customer_reviews.author: R R Maier

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bult this into a circuit that lets me know if someone is entering my driveway. The auxiliary contacts on the pushbutton work well, The chime unit is loud and clear, and I've had no problems with it receiving the signal from the pushbutton.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: It's loud enough to hear upstairs and the flashing light is actually great to let someone know what is happening
customer_reviews.text: OK, I tried it... What do you know! The darn thing works very well. It's loud enough to hear upstairs and the flashing light is actually great to let someone know what is happening. It programs very easily and all in all, is just a very good item.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Mounting problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my sister. We've tried everything - from Velcro,to 2-way tape (trying to mount it on wood) Nothing works! The push-button remote keeps falling off the wall! We live in south Georgia (USA) where the heat is sometimes pretty high. Any ideas on the best way to mount it?
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Information
customer_reviews.text: Listed with 3 Push Buttons incorrect only comes with 1
customer_reviews.author: Christine Russell

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell RCWL330A1000/N P4-Premium Portable Wireless Doorbell / Door Chime and Push Button
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mother about two or three years ago, and it is still working very well. just changed out the battery for the first time in Feb of this year, 2018. It rings very loudly; my mother, who is 97 years old, loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Lula Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I think most of the built in chimes are terrible. But it functions well
customer_reviews.text: I think most of the built in chimes are terrible. But it functions well, and is decently loud. I do like that you can set up multiple door bells to it and have distinctive chimes / icons for each.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Plenty of options (easy to add a 2nd door or motion sensor w/ different chime, etc. ) Would have given it 5 stars , but the volume could be a little louder for those of us that are a bit hard of hearing. Also a LED light on the door button would be a nice improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hebeisen

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Worked great in one of NJ's worst winters ever.
customer_reviews.text: This door chime works great. At first, I thought it wasn't loud enough especially when the speakers are in the back of the unit. But when I did finally hang it on the wall, it just resonates. My other concern was whether the button would be able to withstand the cold temperatures and weather in NJ, especially this winter in that it was one of the worst snowy winters in NJ history. And it definitely past the test. It worked in negative degree temps and our wet winter weather. I just hope/pray it lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: famiLee

customer_reviews.title: Simple set up, effective, worth my money
customer_reviews.text: So I've been without a doorbell for several years until now. Years of hanging up signs that read "please knock", or "doorbell broken, yell ding dong", taping over the bad doorbell button... I should have just bought one of these in the first place. It took me less than ten minutes to install with a front and back door button. The tones are much nicer sounding than people screaming or banging on my door. Also, my dogs either can't hear it or much prefer it to the knocking because they no longer bark when company arrives. This was definitely worth the purchase. I do wonder how long the batteries will last though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: works through block walls and metal roll up doors.
customer_reviews.text: It's about 150' from the button to the bell and signal is strong enough to go through cinder block walls and a metal roll up door. I chose this model because the specs gave it a 450' range. Didn't want to take a chance on any of the other cheaper models. And you can turn the sound off and have just the flashing light. Now when we have a delivery at our roll up door they don't have to call the office phone to get our attention.
customer_reviews.author: DaByuBoy

customer_reviews.title: Works great but only in one floor-will a 2nd one work w/buzzer?
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these so I could hear the door bell upstairs -- and it does a great job of that. I'd give them 5 stars were it not for my one problem with the product: I can NOT hear the doorbell ring when I am downstairs. Does anyone know: if I buy another one of these, will it ring (along with the upstairs one) when someone outdoors presses the button? In other words, do they all work on the same frequency -- or will each door bell only cause the unit sold with it to ring? If anyone knows the answer to this question -- or where to address this question at Honeywell --I'd be grateful.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, stop working in 35 days
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, stop working in 35 days, Amazon gives you 30 days then SOL - $45 wasted. I think Amazon used to have a better return policy for garbage, maybe it was just for Prime members of which I am - VERY Disappointing. I've built my whole Honeywell system around this garbage but I'm certainly not going to through good money after bad and buy another one. @#@#$%#
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Clark

customer_reviews.title: It's Loud and It Works Mounted To METAL.
customer_reviews.text: We have no choice but to mount our doorbell button to a piece of aluminum trim and this is the only wireless doorbell we could find that would work. All the others I tried wouldn't work when the button was mounted to metal. It's also very loud compared to all the others we tried. Do it right the first time, spend the extra $ and you won't be disappointed. I just wish they'd make a version where the chime unit plugs into a wall outlet.
customer_reviews.author: SkydivingNerd

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless doorbell!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our new house because the electrician didn't run wires for a door bell! He only had it set up for an intercom system which we didn't want. I had bought the other version of this for my brother and he loved it. So I decided to buy this one and it works great! It's loud enough to hear thought our house. We have 3 buttons hooked up to the unit, and it works flawlessly! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a wireless doorbell that produces a single sound. This is a nice upgrade, you can select from at least 6 I think. One nice thing is that I can buy and replace the Push (the Transmitter Switch) if something happens to it. Plus the receiver can accommodate more than one Push (this is good). Not only that you can program the extra Push to sound different from the main Push.
customer_reviews.author: deuce

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with this product!
customer_reviews.text: We have been looking for a door chime like this for quite awhile, so we immediately ordered the product when we found it on Amazon.com. It arrived quickly, and we were so happy with the look of it plus the selections for the chime. We hated our obnoxious, very loud door bell. This one was easy to install and rather than mount the unit that stays inside, we can easily carry it with us from room to room or just set it on a table or shelf. The chime we chose (out of several options that are also adjustable for volume) is pleasant, doesn't annoy us, and doesn't startle our cat! It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: BKR

customer_reviews.title: Solid Doorbell system with Traditional Doorbell Chimes
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these so we could have one fixed and one mobile receiver in the house. It works very well, was a snap to put the button up and has all the options we were looking for (mainly a "regular" door bell sound--not 57 varieties of corny, dimestore cheapo sounding melodies!). The units are solid and look good (IMHO). Both receivers were easy to synch to the two remotes and system setting changes are easy. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Nice loud door bell
customer_reviews.text: Pros: always works, bell is loud, fairly attractive unit, easy to install and take off the wall if portability is needed Cons: could of made the main unit a tad smaller;on high volume there is some distortion; only a few different sounds to choose from (why not include 30, are doorbell sounds copyrighted?). Could of made the door bell look more like the typical door bell instead of what looks like a mini garage door opener. I'd recommend this unit to friends and family with the aforementioned caveats.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Quality Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: I installed this doorbell a while ago, easy setup and installation. Several chimes to choose from that are loud enough to be heard at the other end of the house. I bought an additional pushbutton and assigned a different chime to it so that I know whether someone is at the front or back door. It flashes if you want it to, and the light is quite bright. It is attractive, yet unobtrusive on the wall near my door. I recommend this
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Very easy setup, great sound and works well.
customer_reviews.text: This could not have been any easier to set up. Just put in the batteries, two screws to put the button on my front door and done. It is nice and loud but it has 3 ring modes, 1. sound, 2. sound and flashing light or 3. just flashing light. It also has 6 different tones to choose from. The range seems to be good also. I took the ringer to the end of my driveway and had the unit in the back yard and it worked. It took a split second to ding dong but that is all.
customer_reviews.author: Francois

customer_reviews.title: A Good Replacement for The Old Doorbell.
customer_reviews.text: Lightning struck in my yard a couple of years ago and I spent hours digging through insulation in an extremely hot attic to find that everything was cooked. There were burn marks all the way from the back door to the 12 volt transformer. So I decided to go wireless. Bought this product after a lot of research. Now two years later it stopped working. Finally narrowed the problem to a bad pushbutton - ordered one - and the problem was solved. If you purchase one of these, go ahead and buy two pushbuttons. Trust me it will save a lot of troubleshoting time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup, took all of ten minutes to throw the batteries in, attach it to the wall and attach the doorbell outside next to the door. Very simple settings allow us to turn the bell from audible to just a flashing light (which we use often as we have little ones on nap schedules). Seems to have tons of options we can use that I haven't even looked into yet. For the price you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Cloyd

customer_reviews.title: Silver and Black, Silver and Black, There's Nothing Like ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in conjunction with the Honeywell RPWL301A1006/A Decor Wireless Surface Mount Push Button this guy keeps going. I thought the batteries might last a year at the most but it won't quit. Nice tone too, not tinnie like alot of the door bells. The light flashes to warn me when the rebel scum approach my place with pitch forks and burning torches.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky RamBooty McKinnon

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, used at my 89 yr old moms ...
customer_reviews.text: easy setup, used at my 89 yr old moms hose with one ringer and two receivers, easy set up and loud enough for her. how long the batteries last we shall see. not a plug in!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Kunde

customer_reviews.title: Decided to go with this wireless product and I am very pleased with my decision
customer_reviews.text: Live in a 100 plus year old home where drilling holes in the walls often causes damage to the vintage of the home. Decided to go with this wireless product and I am very pleased with my decision. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. It is very customizable with different rings ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. It is very customizable with different rings for the front and back doors. This helps us to know where the person is ringing from. Being able to turn the sound off is great for a sleeping newborn. The flashing lights let you know someone is at the door if you are paying attention. Also, you can turn the volume down and have the lights flash. I would think that this would be good for someone with hearing loss.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy O. Morford

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it works better than the 300 in a non-concrete structure
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the range works in an open field or a wooden frame structure, but I live in a concrete house and I compared the range to the rcwl300a, which I also ordered. The 300 actually had a longer range, not by much. Neither one lived up to the advertised range, but I wasn't going to pay twice the price for a doorbell with a shorter range. Kept the 300, returned the 330. Maybe it works better than the 300 in a non-concrete structure.
customer_reviews.author: ac island boy

customer_reviews.title: Plenty Loud Enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly mother who has arthritic hands. She does not have trouble pushing the button. Sometimes, I misplace the unit. I just ring the bell to locate it. I hear it loud and clear even when it's downstairs, in fact I have trouble discerning whether it's ringing from downstairs or upstairs. I also love the variety of chimes. The blue strobe light can be a bit annoying but would help if the person doing the monitoring is deaf. It's also very simple to turn off the strobe should you choose to do so. I'm impressed by this unit and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie A.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Loud chimes and so easy to install. I've bought several wireless doorbells before, but they always break. usually the button breaks. but this one is very well made. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Marshall

customer_reviews.title: A good choice
customer_reviews.text: I actaully have aluminum siding which i the bell button was placed on on it still works well although putting it on or around any type of metal shortens the wireless signal, with me putting it on this siding and having closed windows as i'm in the North East it is still working at approx. 20-30 feet away. I like this unit as it can can also be used for security purposes with additional add ons from Honeywell, the bell has a nice tone with with a volume control and a few chimes to choose from. I am happy with my purchase and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JCNY

customer_reviews.title: 450 ft?  Maybe on a clear day on a prarie
customer_reviews.text: This is my third wireless doorbell and I have yet to find one that could broadcast through two walls over a run of 25 feet. The reason I gave this on three stars when I already know the effective range is highly "situational", is that they don't make any clear mention of it. Otherwise I'm sure this is a fine product, but I just have a hard time accepting that they can't come up with a booster system to help those without direct line of sight...or if they do, I haven't seen it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I've been suffering with people knocking on the door or being forced to go from the back where the garage is all the way around to the front to knock (I live in a city row home). I didn't get a wireless door bell at the local home improvement stores because the selection was poor as was the quality. Took a chance based on this door bell the reviews and I couldn't be more happy. I have one push button about 20 feet away and the other outside the garage about 55 feet away. Both work great and the selection of tones and features is great. I would definitely recommend this door bell to anyone looking for a wireless bell.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Ding Dong - Works Great
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do and does it well. Installation was a snap. Nice choice of Ding Dongs and other tunes. I haven't tried walking down the street with it to test its range but for the distances in and out of our house there is no problem. The volume control could take it a little louder but it is adequate for my hearing needs. Nice bracket design for its in house location in a hallway but easy off and on the bracket to take it outside when needed. What else can I say? Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Olde Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It’s loud and easy to sync to the chime I wanted. I have two different chimes. One for the front door and a different chime for gate.
customer_reviews.author: RP&EP

customer_reviews.title: Product failure
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell worked ok for The doorbell worked ok for about 10 months. Then it died. Not repairable.
customer_reviews.author: hreeser

customer_reviews.title: Love These Chimes Repeat
customer_reviews.text: After lightening struck our intercom/doorbell, we purchased the Honeywell door chime and an extra push button. The comments in the customer review section were very helpful. They were extremely easy to install and set to separate chimes for each of the two doors. We have one on the front door and one by the side door.The chimes are clear and loud. We can hear them though out the house. They are actually better than our old wired doorbell. Who knew? We would absolutely recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Robert & Mary

customer_reviews.title: It functions so far
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this for a week. It works well. We had a terrible experience with the ring doorbell and this was recommended. The chime is loud, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: Palm Beach Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy and loud. Good looking.
customer_reviews.text: This chime is loud (adjustable) and has good sensitivity. It is much easier to set up and program than the others that I tried. My doors have metal siding trim around them, so the push buttons didn't work when mounted beside the door. I had to mount them in the middle of the door. The chime is portable (or you can hang it on the wall) and smart-looking, so we just keep it on the dining room table. I like the flashing alert light (which you can disable if you don't like it.)
customer_reviews.author: Doug K.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for Deaf Aunt
customer_reviews.text: We love this nicely made and efficient portable wireless door chime with strobe light. Our aunt is 88 years old and loves visits from friends and neighbors. She was missing visits because she can't hear the doorbell. This wireless and portable doorbell is light and easy to carry around the house so she can just carry it with her and the strobe light is perfect, makes enough light that she can see it flashing even if she is looking elsewhere in the room. The light catches her attention and she can respond to the doorbell. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: Great Doorbell...!
customer_reviews.text: Great doorbell! This is a great doorbell with rich sounding chimes, no "tinny" sound at all. I don't know why Honeywell decided to include a very "cheap" looking remote for the door though, doesn't match the chime box at all. I guess to force you to buy the Honeywell Decor switch which matches perfectly the case of the door bell. Anyway I bought the decor switch put it at the front door and put the "cheap" one in the garage. Thanks Amazon for another great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stone

customer_reviews.title: amazing product
customer_reviews.text: soooooo much better than standard wired units. The portability is awesome. I have a home theater room that is a full cinema experience so when we are expecting people we move one of the units into the theater and the visual indicator flashes when someone is at the front door. Works perfect if I'm in the backyard BBQ'ing as well. Awesome stuff. We have two of these units on a single push-button doorbell unit to cover the whole home (+4000sq ft home)
customer_reviews.author: PoohThePirate

customer_reviews.title: I can still hear it and it still works outside 80 to 90 feet away the choices on bell tones is great because I'm hard of hearing
customer_reviews.text: . Put this bell in the middle of my basement. I take the bell out in the garage in the back of the house, and when they ring the bell. I can still hear it and it still works outside 80 to 90 feet away the choices on bell tones is great because I'm hard of hearing, so one I sent. I can hear no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD AICHINGER

customer_reviews.title: Works great, even in a steel house!
customer_reviews.text: I'm ordering another one of these because it worked so well. Putting the first in the basement. I ordered another push button and now have one on the front and rear of the house. This is a steel house (red iron frame, steel studs, steel siding). The thing works just fine, all the way to the basement. I tested up on the first floor where I'll be adding the second unit and of course that's no problem either. It gets a "5"!!! Note: you can use a 6vdc converter rather than using 4 - "C" cell batteries as those batteries are going to cost you about $5 a year.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works great and an AC adapter is available if you don't want to use batteries
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this bc I am chronically ill, which sometimes makes me bed-ridden. My family member is hearing impaired so calling him on the phone was not possible. The flashing light on this and the adjustable volume on this are great. You can also pick from among 6 different ring tones, which has also been helpful in my situation. And since I don't care if I "lose" the wireless feature, I went ahead and got an adapter for this, rather than the C batteries that it takes. Abt 50$ all together for everything and I think it's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: lyrical

customer_reviews.title: Good Appearance and Tone Selection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my upcoming custom home, so I haven't used it much other than to verify it works. I am picky about the tone and I found the one that I like. It is loud enough to be heard a reasonable distance. It runs on C batteries, but I used some AA to C adapters to test this unit. I would have rather it used double the number of AA batteries than to choose C batteries. C batteries are not all that common anymore.
customer_reviews.author: M CoxTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great product
customer_reviews.text: This wireless doorbell works great. No wiring. Batteries working for a long long time. The flashing notification is absolutely brilliant. Listening to a loud movie or music in the living room when someone comes to the door the flash still notifies you that someone rang. Extremely bright flashing notification LED can be turned off if its not your thing. Has a bunch of nice chimes. Its portable and can be moved around if you need. LOVE LOVE LOVE it! Easy to setup, only takes a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Valis

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works For Me~!!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying all the "other" Brand-Name DoorBell systems, I FINALLY found one that works!!!!!!!!!!! This system is Professionally-Made & Durable and LOUD!!!! (I can hear the buzzer/chimes with my bedroom door closed..even when sleeping!) Thanks Honeywell, you have continued to make GREAT PRODUCTS while the others search for cheap chinese-labor knockoff JUNK~!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SpikefromNYC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value - works through concrete walls!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit after buying and returning another doorbell (much more expensive) than the Honeywell. I am more than satisfied with the Honeywell. It is placed about 25' away (distance between transmitter and receiver): through once concrete wall, and normal interior studded wall (1). Works every time. No delay on signal. Nice looking unit, smallish receiver. Should have gotten this one first - price does not alway mean better! This Honeywell Unit was almost $100 dollars cheaper than our original unit, but has performed 100% better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution when a wired doorbell dies!
customer_reviews.text: When our original WIRED doorbell stopped working, AND after wasting half a day trying to repair it, I ordered the WIRELESS Honeywell Door Chime/Strobe from Amazon. Glad I did because, in the past, if I was watching TV or listening to music with my headphones on, I could miss the doorbell chime. NOT ANYMORE! Now, even if I don't hear the chime, the strobe light gets my attention I'm relaxed, knowing I'm not going to miss a delivery or visitor because of having the music turned up too loud! I LOVE IT! :) THANKS AMAZON!
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: It worth the money
customer_reviews.text: the buttons can be quite a way from the unit and still picks up the signal. it is nice looking fits in to room and not noticable
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: Had bought the Heath-Zenith product and the transmitter/receiver pair was unreliable in ringing the chime through our stucco/block wall. Bought this Honeywell system, and not only can it transmit through the wall, but it reaches us in our backyard when we carry this portable (battery powered) unit with us, when we want to hear the front door bell. The flashing light is a great feature, so even if the music is loud, you can still see the receiver indicate the door bell ringing.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: The flashing siren/strobe light is a nice touch if you somehow didn't hear the bell ring
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 in total, 2 older models and this newer model. Make sure that you have the right battery size. The older models require AA batteries, but this model requires C batteries. The flashing siren/strobe light is a nice touch if you somehow didn't hear the bell ring. I guess this strobe light feature requires more operating power. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: rj

customer_reviews.title: Metal clad doors--important note!
customer_reviews.text: The push button worked only sporadically when mounted on the outside of our metal-clad apartment door. The fix is pretty simple, though. Strip the end of some copper bell wire, open the push button unit, and attach the wire to the spiral antenna. Thread the wire through a hole in the plastic mounting plate and then through a small hole in the door. The wire doesn't have to be very large or conspicuous on the inside to make signal transmission reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ramos Washington

customer_reviews.title: I can carry it around
customer_reviews.text: I don't hear well and sometimes miss hearing the doorbell if I don't have my hearing aids in. No more! I can carry this doorbell around with me and hear it and see the bright flashing lights. I had a "barking doorbell" for a lot of years, but at 15 she quit eating and I had to have her put to sleep. :-( I'm planning on getting another "barking doorbell" soon, just haven't had the time. This has been an adequate substitute, just not as nice for company and companionship.
customer_reviews.author: Crystalscout

customer_reviews.title: This works for so many reasons.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful unit, especially if a member of the house=hold is hard of hearing. In our case, we did not mount it, but placed it on a window ledge so it can be carried to a distant room so it can be easily heard. I bought three extra buttons, one for each exterior door. Then we set a different "ring tone" for each door. Along with the lights that identify each door individually, it is no problem getting there without guessing where the knock came from. Excellent product for the price and the wireless range of the buttons in approximately 400 feet. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: R. H. Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The doorbell itself works, but the “clicker” doesn’t anymore, even after replacing the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Flanders

customer_reviews.title: it's one of those sounds designed to annoy the $*** out of you
customer_reviews.text: Even though it says there are six chimes, if you pair it with the wired door contacts, you only get one chime. Unfortunately, it's one of those sounds designed to annoy the $*** out of you, rather than sound pleasant. So the whole contraption is worth nothing more than a buzzer.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Lindemuth

customer_reviews.title: Quality Wireless Door Chime
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this particular door chime unit to expand an existing system that we bought a couple of years ago to replace a cheap product that died after its first NH Winter. We've been very pleased with the system and particularly like the flexibility of being able to move the door chimes around to suit our needs - sometimes taking a chime unit out into the back yard to ensure that we know when someone is at the door. It's survived several winters and we've had no problems with signal range.
customer_reviews.author: NHDiane

product_meta.title: Honeywell RCWL330A1000/N P4-Premium Portable Wireless Doorbell / Door Chime and Push Button
product_meta.description:
Size:MediumHoneywell Premium Portable Wireless Door Chime and Push. 3 Chimes: Ding Dong, St. Clements, & Westminster with adjustable volume control; 3 Visual alerts add a layer of security; Works with up to 3 transmitters: bell push buttons, motion detector or door contacts; Very simple installation - portable or wall mount; CD Quality sound; 450-ft range; Extender compatible with any chime; Push compatibility: E.

AMAZON.COM
The Honeywell RCWL330A P4 Premium Portable Plus Wireless Door Chime makes it easy to replace your home's generic doorbell ring with a chime tune that better fits your individual style. This chime is also compatible with a wide range of optional security accessories that can help you safeguard your home and family, and it comes complete with a pre-programmed bell push button.

 

Wireless Design for User-Friendly Setup and Operation
The chime's highly portable wireless design lets you take it with you to the patio, your garage workshop, or your home office--wherever you're most likely to hear it. Thanks to its industry-leading 450-foot working range, you'll be sure never to miss a visitor's arrival no matter where you are. Versatile and Elegant to Match Your Lifestyle
Featuring a sleek, contemporary look that's sure to blend in with your home's decor, the RCWL330A delivers CD-quality sound with fully adjustable volume, giving you complete control over the sound of your door chime. Six distinct tunes are included for you to choose from: Ding Dong, St. Clements, Westminster, Tube Chime, Warm Brass, and Fantasy.

 With this Premium Portable Plus chime, you also have the option of activating the flashing light notification--a necessity for any member of your household with hearing loss or for those who want to know if the chime has been activated while loud music is playing or a vacuum cleaner is running. And if you've got an infant or young child in the house, you'll be happy to know that you have the option of turning the chime down or completely off--a great option for nap time.

 Décor Wireless Bell Push Button for Convenience
The included RPWL300A Décor Wireless Bell Push Button is a slim, stylish accessory that lets you start using your wireless chime right away. It's crafted from white, UV-resistant plastic that holds its true color longer to preserve the curb appeal of your home. This surface-mount push button offers a feedback LED display and low-battery indicator for easy reference. Its individually coded, self-learning design simplifies programming and helps prevent interference from other users or appliances. This push button comes with the necessary battery.

 In case you need an additional bell push button or are looking for a push that matches you door's hardware, the RCWL330A also works with the wide variety of décor pushes that feature "E" compatibility (sold separately).

 Advanced Security Compatibility for Peace of Mind
The chime works with up to six transmitters, allowing you to connect a single chime to push buttons located at different entrances and making it easy to implement a variety of security measures that will quickly alert you if an unwanted guest decides to pay your home a visit.

 You have the option of linking this chime to 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A premium door chime from Honeywell with the option of adding on security accessories offering peace of mind and custom upgrade possibilities. Add-on push buttons for other entrances around the home, door and window contacts for added security or motion detectors for peace of mind inside and out. The RCWL330A incorporates six (6) visual alert icons to let you know which device has been triggered with an exclusive event log so you can recall which devices were last triggered in case you missed a call. The product has the flexibility to go wherever you want it, on the wall, on the patio or in the basement and the industry best 450-Feet operating range provides the performance to work virtually anywhere in, out or around your home. CD quality sound and fully adjustable volume round out the features for this door chime plus security product.

See more
feature_bullets: Works with up to six (6) push buttons, motion detectors or door contacts for added security and convenience
Six (6) chime tunes, fully adjustable volume and six (6) visual alert icons
Self learning code system automatically adjusts to eliminate interference

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,376 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
